subject: Art
title: Color Vibration
description: When adjacent colors of equal value seem to shimmer and buzz.

hook.text: Place pure red next to pure green of equal value. Stare at the edge. It shimmers, buzzes, and vibrates. Your eyes can't find a comfortable focus. That's color vibration.

buildup.text: Vibration occurs when two complementary (or near-complementary) colors of similar value meet. Your eyes rapidly switch between perceiving each color, creating a visual buzz at the boundary.

discovery.text: Op Art artists like Bridget Riley deliberately created vibrating compositions. The effect is physical ‚Äî it strains the eye. Used strategically, it adds energy. Used carelessly, it causes headaches.

twist.text: To stop vibration: change the value of one color, add a neutral separator between them, or reduce the saturation of one. A thin black or white line between vibrating colors calms them instantly.

climax.text: Red text on green background: unreadable, vibrating. Add a thin white outline to the text: suddenly readable. Understanding vibration lets you fix problems and create effects.

punchline.text: Color vibration is physics messing with your eyes. Control it or it controls you.

quiz.question: How can you stop color vibration between two adjacent complementary colors?
options: Add a neutral separator or change the value of one color
